tournament.name: MTG SEA Championship Final - Oracle Events

decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly build a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures and spells. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient and low-cost spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage while also utilizing card draw and manipulation with cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand. The mana base is designed to support the red-blue color combination, allowing for consistent casting of spells while maintaining tempo. Overall, the deck aims to win the game quickly by establishing an aggressive board presence and dealing damage efficiently.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on aggressively controlling the board with cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down while also deploying evasive threats like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat. The deck has a slight focus on card advantage with Enduring Curiosity and Preacher of the Schism. The deck also contains powerful finishers like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. Overall, the deck aims to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with removal spells and threats that are hard to deal with.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on controlling the board with removal spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down while utilizing creatures like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat to apply pressure to the opponent. Cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Preacher of the Schism help disrupt the opponent's strategy, while cards like Enduring Curiosity provide card advantage. The deck also includes some powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Gix's Command to help close out the game. The mana base is set up to ensure the deck can consistently cast its spells on curve.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's plans while efficiently removing threats from the board. By using cards like Duress and Dispelling Exhale to get rid of key cards in your opponent's hand, and spells like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to deal with creatures, you can maintain control of the game. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Oildeep Gearhulk to close out the game once you have established control. With a mix of disruption and powerful creatures, this deck aims to outlast and outplay your opponent.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on card advantage, removal, and disruption to outlast the opponent. Through the use of counter spells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the game tempo and gradually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes a mix of efficient creatures and powerful enchantments to provide additional win conditions and value. By carefully managing resources and making strategic decisions, this deck aims to outplay and outlast opponents in a Standard 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Omniscience Combo to quickly cast powerful spells like Roiling Dragonstorm and Temporary Lockdown for massive board presence and control. Marang River Regent and Ephara's Dispersal provide additional support while Stock Up and Meticulous Archive help draw into combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption with Spell Pierce and Founding the Third Path. The mana base includes Floodfarm Verge and a mix of lands to support casting a variety of spells. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly play low-cost aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand help maintain card advantage, while the land base focuses on ensuring a consistent mana base for casting spells. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and direct damage spells to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to deal damage to the opponent early on. It also utilizes spells such as Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to further push damage through. The deck aims to maintain card advantage and dig for key pieces with cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan by providing consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This deck aims to establish control over the game by using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures. The key strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan, while building up a board presence with powerful creatures like Overlord of the Hauntwoods and Zur, Eternal Schemer. By controlling the battlefield and maintaining a steady flow of threats, this deck can grind out advantages and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy and ensure smooth gameplay.

The main idea of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly bring out aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Stadium Headliner, with support from cards like Boros Charm and Frontline Rush to deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Torch the Tower and Warleader's Call to control the board and keep up the pressure on the opponent. With a good mana base and a focus on quick, impactful plays, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive gameplay, utilizing a mix of creatures and spells to overwhelm opponents quickly. The deck aims to establish early board presence with efficient creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Optimistic Scavenger, supported by disruptive spells like Fear of Isolation and Hopeless Nightmare. By utilizing a combination of creature aggression and spell disruption, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and prevent them from stabilizing, ultimately leading to a swift victory. The mana base is crafted to take advantage of the Esper color combination's strengths and ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main concept of this Esper Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing a combination of low-cost creatures like Nurturing Pixie and Optimistic Scavenger, along with disruptive spells like Get Lost and Hopeless Nightmare. By applying pressure early and consistently with cards like Sunpearl Kirin and Stormchaser's Talent, the deck aims to control the board and force the opponent to react defensively. The inclusion of cards like Fear of Isolation and This Town Ain't Big Enough further amplifies the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Hired Claw, and Manifold Mouse, while utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to clear the way for attacks. Witchstalker Frenzy helps to pump up the team and Monstrous Rage adds extra power to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck also includes some protection with Tersa Lightshatter and utility lands like Soulstone Sanctuary to support the aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. Monastery Swiftspear and Slickshot Show-Off are used to chip away at the opponent's life total early on, while Cori-Steel Cutter and Drake Hatcher provide additional threats. Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage help remove opposing creatures and push through damage. Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up provide card selection to keep the aggression going. Stormchaser's Talent enhances the power of the creatures in the deck. Spell Pierce offers some protection against opposing spells. The mana base consists of a mix of Islands, Mountains, Riverpyre Verge, Shivan Reef, and Spirebluff Canal to ensure consistent mana production.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures such as Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while using efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck also includes card draw and counter spells to maintain tempo and keep the pressure on opponents. The inclusion of cards like Witchstalker Frenzy and Into the Flood Maw provide additional threats and ways to close out games quickly. The mana base is focused on producing the necessary colors for spells while minimizing potential drawbacks.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of board wipes, counterspells, and card draw to outlast the opponent. This deck aims to stabilize the board with cards like Day of Judgment and Sunfall, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Get Lost and Three Steps Ahead. The creatures in this deck are primarily used for defense and card advantage, with Jace, the Perfected Mind and Beza, the Bounding Spring providing additional card draw. Overall, the goal is to control the game until the win condition can be achieved.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions and resources through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and cards that disrupt their strategy. It also includes powerful creatures that can dominate the battlefield once the opponent's threats are neutralized. The deck utilizes a mix of lands to ensure consistent mana production while also providing protection against opposing spells. By managing the board and limiting the opponent's options, this deck aims to outlast its opponent and secure victory through superior card advantage and powerful creatures.

The key concept of this Azorius Aggro deck is to create an aggressive strategy by utilizing cards that allow for card draw, temporary lockdown of opponents, and disruptive spells. It aims to quickly build up an advantage on the battlefield through efficient creatures like Picklock Prankster and Abhorrent Oculus, while also providing some control elements with cards like Soul Partition and No More Lies. By maintaining a balance between aggression and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of card advantage and efficient threats.

The deck focuses on using a combination of low-cost aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The strategy involves blending evasion, removal, and card draw to maintain pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. Key cards like Deep-Cavern Bat and Spyglass Siren provide early threats, while cards like Enduring Curiosity and Phantom Interference help maintain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Sheoldred, the Apocalypse can serve as a powerful finisher, ensuring victory once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck aims to win quickly and decisively through a combination of aggression and control.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy while aggressively attacking with a mix of creatures and spells. By using control elements like counterspells and removal along with aggressive creatures, you aim to keep your opponent on the back foot and whittle down their life total quickly. Key cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Spyglass Siren provide strong threats on the board, while cards like Phantom Interference and Preacher of the Schism disrupt your opponent's plans. The deck aims to win the game quickly through a combination of creature beats and strategic disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of control spells, card draw, and powerful creatures to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Lightning Helix and Temporary Lockdown, while also generating card advantage with Stock Up and Meticulous Archive, the deck aims to establish control of the game. The inclusion of powerful finishers like Marang River Regent and Roiling Dragonstorm allows the deck to close out the game once it has stabilized. The mana base is built to support the three-color requirements of Jeskai Control.

The key strategy of this Jeskai Control deck is to establish board control through removal spells like Lightning Helix and Get Lost, while also utilizing counterspells like No More Lies to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with cards like Experimental Augury and Temporary Lockdown. Additionally, the inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Ral, Crackling Wit and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms helps to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support all three colors efficiently to ensure smooth casting of spells.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and using spells to disrupt your opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of creatures with abilities that allow you to tap down opponents' creatures or generate card advantage. The deck also features cards that can provide additional value or protection for your creatures. The mana base is composed of lands that can produce all the necessary colors to cast your spells efficiently. By utilizing a combination of creatures and spells, this deck aims to overwhelm your opponent quickly and secure victory through relentless aggression.

This Jeskai Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost aggressive creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Marauding Mako, supported by direct damage spells like Torch the Tower and Inspiring Vantage to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Fear of Missing Out and Profit's Eidetic Memory help maintain card advantage and control the tempo of the game. The deck also includes some control elements like Spell Pierce and Tersa Lightshatter, giving the player flexibility to react to their opponent's strategy. Overall, this deck aims to apply consistent pressure and finish off the opponent swiftly.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Omniscience card to cast powerful spells for free and win the game through a combination of card advantage and disruption. Marang River Regent and Roiling Dragonstorm provide a strong win condition while Moment of Truth and Ephara's Dispersal help maintain control of the game. The deck also includes disruption spells like Confounding Riddle and Temporary Lockdown to slow down opponents and protect key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm opponents with powerful spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming your opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells in order to finish the game as quickly as possible. It aims to deal direct damage to the opponent while also controlling the board with powerful creatures. With a low curve and a high aggression level, this deck is designed to win fast and decisively, putting pressure on the opponent from the very beginning. The key strategy is to play aggressively, using burn spells efficiently and attacking relentlessly to defeat the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and a fast-paced strategy. By using efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Manifold Mouse, combined with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. Cards like Monstrous Rage and Witchstalker Frenzy help to give the creatures additional power and trample, ensuring that the damage gets through. The mana base is streamlined with mostly Mountains to support the low curve of the deck.

This deck focuses on using cheap, aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By including cards that allow for card draw and mana efficiency, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while ensuring a consistent stream of threats. The mana base is designed to support the low curve of the deck and enable the player to play their spells on curve. Overall, the deck prioritizes speed and aggression to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, combined with burn spells and card draw to maintain momentum. Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter provide early pressure, while cards like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage offer additional reach and removal. Drake Hatcher and Slickshot Show-Off offer versatility and can provide incremental advantage. The deck also aims to smooth out draws and dig for key cards with Opt, Sleight of Hand, and Stock Up. The mana base is optimized for consistency and to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively building up a board presence with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also utilizing burn spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to clear the way and deal direct damage to the opponent. Opt and Sleight of Hand help to filter through the deck and find key cards, while cards like Drake Hatcher and Slickshot Show-Off provide additional value and evasion. The mana base is focused on ensuring consistent access to both red and blue mana sources for casting spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly building up a strong board presence and dealing direct damage to the opponent. By utilizing efficient spells and creatures, it aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize. The key strategy revolves around aggressive plays and tempo advantage, using cards like Burst Lightning and Cori-Steel Cutter to control the board while dealing damage. The deck also includes card draw and mana fixing to ensure consistency in its aggressive game plan. By carefully managing resources and making calculated attacks, this deck aims to win before the opponent can mount a defense.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By utilizing powerful control cards such as Temporary Lockdown, Stock Up, and No More Lies, the deck aims to stall the opponent's game plan while gradually generating card advantage. Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Overlord of the Mistmoors provide additional threats and win conditions, ensuring that the deck can close out the game once it has established control. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements and allow for consistent casting of spells.
